#Text=Brussels , Belgium
#Text=Correspondents : Brian McNeil and Steven Fruitsmaak

#Text=Starting off from a meeting point at the Brussels Central Station , the anonymous protesters proceeded on foot to arrive at their licensed protest point outside the Brussels Stock Exchange around 12:30 local time .
#Text=The turnout was about half that of the previous protest with only 20 or so people present .
#Text=Per advice from the police , cake was not on offer .
#Text=It had been pointed out that this would likely get the protesters overrun by children and vagrants .
#Text=Unlike other countries , Belgium has laws prohibiting protesters to cover their faces , leaving the protesters to wear sunglasses and shawls .
#Text=The protest could not take place in front of Scientology 's headquarters because an E.U. summit was scheduled to continue until today .
#Text=Scientology members were allowed to be active outside their headquarters , for their " open door day " .
#Text=No special activities inside their building was observed , just volunteers handing out flyers to perhaps a dozen passers-by .
#Text=The press release for this open door day was devoted to Anonymous :
#Text=The police did n't allow Anonymous near the Scientology headquarters , but the Scientologists were allowed to stage an ' open door day ' .

#Text=" Anonymous " , a group of cyber-terrorists hiding their identities behind masks and computer anonymity , has targeted the Scientology religion , its Churches , leaders and parishioners with hate speech and hate crimes . ...

#Text=Death threats and threats to plant nitroglycerin bombs in Churches have made it necessary to take security precautions and identify members of this group responsible for these crimes . — Scientology press release

#Text=The Scientologists said the event was inspired by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights , which is however remembered on December 10 ( also mentioned on the flags outside their office , see photo ) .
#Text=The United Nations Human Rights Council was established on March 15 ( 2006 ) , a date closer to this weekend .

#Text=Wikinews spoke to a Scientology representative in the European headquarters , which are located in the political heart of Brussels ; Law Street , just next to the Belgian and European parliament . Since Scientology was devoting the afternoon to human rights , we asked for Scientology 's opinion about human rights controversies in the United States ( such as the Guantanamo Bay detainees ) .
#Text=The representative told Wikinews that the Church is a religious movement and avoids taking general political stances .
#Text=The representative was also confident about the outcome of a pending lawsuit from the Belgian federal prosecutor .

#Text=After an eight-year investigation , the Belgian justice said that the local and European chapters , as well as , members would be accused of blackmailing , swindling members , breaking trade and privacy laws , unlawfully practising medicine , and forming a criminal organisation .
#Text=" The file is empty , " said the Scientology representative , who asserted that the inquiry had been so lengthy because the state could not prove any wrongdoings by the Church .
#Text=He said that unlike in the US , Scientology is not seeking official recognition in Belgium , which recognises only six religions .
#Text=He also claimed that there were more than 1,000 Scientologists in Belgium .
